articles.author: Nandita Bose
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden on Thursday called China a "ticking time bomb" because of its economic challenges and said the country was in trouble because of weak growth.
articles.title: Biden calls China a 'ticking time bomb' due to economic troubles

articles.author: Clare Jim
articles.description: Shares of China's largest private property developer Country Garden (2007.HK) plunged to a record low on Friday after it forecast a first-half loss of up to $7.6 billion and a media report said it was preparing for a debt restructuring.
articles.title: Country Garden shares hit record low on loss forecast, restructuring fears

articles.author: Greg Bensinger
articles.description: Alphabet Inc’s (GOOGL.O) Waymo and General Motors’ Cruise can operate paid robotaxi services using unmanned self-driving vehicles throughout San Francisco, California state regulators voted on Thursday, in the face of vigorous pushback from city transportation, safety agencies and many residents.
articles.title: California agency approves San Francisco robotaxi expansion amid heavy opposition

articles.author: Tom Westbrook
articles.description: Asian stocks edged towards a weekly loss on Friday and the U.S. dollar was headed for a month of gains after U.S. inflation came in steady, without the hoped-for surprise on the downside.
articles.title: Asia stocks slip as US CPI fails to enthuse; dollar up

articles.author: John Kruzel, Andrew Chung
articles.description: The U.S. Supreme Court on Thursday agreed to hear a challenge by President Joe Biden's administration to the legality of OxyContin maker Purdue Pharma's bankruptcy settlement, putting on hold a deal that would shield its wealthy Sackler family owners from lawsuits over their role in the country's opioid epidemic.
articles.title: US Supreme Court halts Purdue Pharma bankruptcy settlement pending review

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Semiconductor shortages that have created bottlenecks for Germany's car industry will take years to resolve despite chipmakers' plans to build factories in the country, a senior Audi manager was quoted as saying on Friday.
articles.title: Chip shortage in Germany's car industry will last years - Audi manager

articles.author: Fransiska Nangoy
articles.description: Indonesia hopes the recent exit of global giants Shell and Chevron from two long-delayed natural gas projects will jumpstart their development, as it races to more than double gas production by 2030.
articles.title: Analysis: Indonesia's gas ambition faces investor test with Shell, Chevron exits

articles.author: Marco Garcia
articles.description: A wildfire that swept through the picturesque resort town of Lahaina on Hawaii's Maui island has killed at least 36 people, authorities said, leaving smoldering ruins in its wake and forcing thousands to flee the devastation.
articles.title: Hawaii wildfires ravage Maui island resort city, killing dozens

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: While the market mostly shrugged off President Joe Biden's move to prohibit some U.S. technology investments in China, U.S. investors said they were worried Beijing would retaliate or pull back from buying American technology.
articles.title: US investors flag retaliation risks after Biden's China tech curbs

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China has uncovered an alleged spy for the U.S. Central Intelligence Agency (CIA), a Chinese national who worked for a military industrial group and was offered money and immigration to the U.S. in exchange for sensitive military information, the state broadcaster reported on Friday.
articles.title: China says uncovers alleged CIA spy, Chinese national recruited in Italy-state TV
